meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dull or uninteresting.
meanings.sent1: The boringness of the lecture made everyone fall asleep.
meanings.sent2: I can't stand the boringness of waiting in long lines.
meanings.sent3: The boringness of the situation was so extreme that even the plants seemed uninterested.
meanings.sent4: The boringness of the gray sky matched the monotony of the empty street.
meanings.sent5: The boringness of the movie was like watching paint dry.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being bored or uninterested.
meanings.sent1: Her face clearly showed the boringness she felt during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: I tried to fight the boringness of the class by doodling in my notebook.
meanings.sent3: The boringness of the situation was so intense that even the clock seemed to slow down out of boredom.
meanings.sent4: The boringness in the room was palpable, like a heavy fog settling over everyone.
meanings.sent5: The boringness of the book was like trudging through a swamp of words.
